column3: I saw her seated on the grass. I went up to tell her not to sit there; for it is not safe to sit on the ground
column4: even in dry weather.As I drew near to Jessie from behind
column5: I heard her talking. To whom could she be talking? There was no one by her side; that is to say
column6: no human being. But soon I found she was talking to a wasp that was coming as if to sting her."Wasp
column10: said she. But the wasp did not heed her. It flew quite near to her face. Instead of striking at the bold insect, she merely drew back a little out of its way; for she thought, Surely the wasp will not harm me
column11: if I do not harm it."
